newsitem.title: USA: Hughes unit wins Navy contract.
newsitem.headline: Hughes unit wins Navy contract.

text.p: Hughes Electronics Corp unit Hughes Aircraft Co Monday announced a $6.4 million contract to design, build and install an underwater test and training range for the U.S. Naval Air Systems Command.

The contract for the Hawaiian Islands Shallow Water Training Range (HISWTR) calls for Hughes to deliver a 60-node undersea sensor array system, a shore electronics station and data communication links by May 1998.
In a statement, Hughes said will build the undersea sensors. Its major subcontractor, Cable and Wireless Marine of Southampton, England, will install the system.
